producer Cecile Frot-Coutaz says Idol isn't making the mistake of trying to replace Simon Cowell with a facsimile.`` You can't, and it would be foolish to try to do that,'' she says. If you go,` We're going to find another slightly nasty British( recording) executive,' people would reject that because that person would never live up to what Simon Cowell is. That's a recipe for disaster. In our very humble opinion, the only thing you can do is try to create a panel that's entertaining, likable and credible. singer is close friends with show supremo Simon Cowell and would be prepared to accept a judging or mentoring role on the new series when it launches later this year. He told the Daily Mail newspaper: Simon Cowell and I have talked about doing things together and I always try to be supportive of people who are friends of mine. . In practice, Andy Coulson made up his mind before Christmas that he would have to go.`` Andy Coulson was running at 70 per cent of his capacity- at best,'' says one ally. He wasn't prepared to work on that basis. David Cameron and George Osborne tried hard to dissuade him from stepping down. also revealed that the American X Factor would be open to contestants as young as 12 years old. Unlike his hit American Idol, the competition is open to vocal groups as well as solo singers. I've never believed there should be a cut-off age for talent, and we are going to put our money where our mouths are with the$ 5 million recording contract, Simon Cowell said. Colin Powell thinks that America`` isn't quite post-racial'' at this time.`` These problems still exist in post-racial America.''
